Item.SEOKeyword: Overview, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Microsoft Graph allows applications to access digital work and digital life data across the intelligent Microsoft cloud. Big advantages for developers: A Unified Microsoft API endpoint for accessing data, intelligence and insights coming from the Microsoft cloud.

Item.SEOKeyword: Call the API, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Answers to some frequently-asked questions about the Microsoft Graph.

Item.SEOKeyword: Query parameters, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Microsoft Graph is OData v4 compliant, provides information about supported OData query parameters

Item.SEOKeyword: Paging, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: implementing paging in the Microsoft Graph

Item.SEOKeyword: Errors, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Errors in the Microsoft Graph API service are returned using standard HTTP status codes, as well as a JSON error response object.

Item.SEOKeyword: Release Notes, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: New features for developers that are available in the November 2015 release of the Microsoft Graph API, as well as any known issues.

Item.SEOKeyword: FAQs, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Answers to some frequently-asked questions about the Microsoft Graph.

Item.SEOKeyword: Permission Scopes, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: The Microsoft Graph API exposes OAuth 2.0 permission scopes that are used to control access that an app has to data. As a developer, you configure your app with the permission scopes appropriate to the access that it requires, typically by using the Azure portal.

Item.SEOKeyword: Associate Office 365 account, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: Use the management portal in Microsoft Azure to manage users, roles, and apps for Office 365.

Item.SEOKeyword: Converged app model, Microsoft Graph API, Overview
Item.SEODescription: The converged authentication model preview enables you to create apps that accept both work and school (Azure AD) as well as personal (Microsoft account) identities.

Item.SEODescription: Use Microsoft Graph to access Microsoft cloud data in an ASP.NET MVC app

approleassignment API, Microsoft Graph API, approleassignment API
Item.SEODescription: Used to record when a user or group is assigned to an application. In this case, the role assignment will result in an application tile showing up on the user app access panel. This entity may also be used to grant another application (modeled as a service principal) access to a resource application in a particular role. You can create, read, update, and delete role assignments. Inherits from DirectoryObject.

Item.SEOKeyword: extensionproperty API, Microsoft Graph API, extensionproperty API
Item.SEODescription: Allows an application to define and use a set of additional properties that can be added to directory objects (users, groups, tenant details, devices, applications, and service principals) without the application requiring an external data store.
